Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the effects of the Fukushima nuclear disaster on marine life by stating that a series of widely-shared photos show the direct effects.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support to prove that the photos provided are directly related to the Fukushima nuclear disaster.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the photos provided are evidence of the effects of the Fukushima nuclear disaster on marine life without sufficient verification.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that some of the photos used as evidence were taken prior to the Fukushima disaster and do not depict cancerous tumors caused by nuclear radiation.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim fails to consider alternative explanations for the effects shown in the photos, such as other sources of contamination or natural causes.
Falters at times: The claim falters at times by relying on misleading information and misinterpretation of the photos.
Understate: There is no evidence of understating biases in the provided claim.
